a.g: I swear by this city, Makkah -
And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
We have certainly created man into hardship.
Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
Does he think that no one has seen him?
Have We not made for him two eyes?
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Pride and Conceit
Look at the blessing (Ni'mah) of Allah upon him, how He transferred him from that humiliation (Dhullah) and scarcity (Qillah) and baseness (Khasah) and filth (Qadharah) to this elevation (Rif'ah) and honor (KarÄmah), so he became existent after non-existence, alive after death, speaking after muteness, seeing after blindness, strong after weakness, knowing after ignorance, guided after misguidance, capable after incapacity, and rich after poverty? He was in his essence nothing, and what thing is baser than nothing? And what scarcity is less than pure non-existence? Then he became through Allah something. And He only created him from the lowly (Dhaleel) dust that is trodden under feet and the filthy (Qadirah) sperm-drop after pure non-existence also to make him know the baseness of his essence so he may know himself by it, and He only perfected the blessing (Ni'mah) upon him so he may know by it his Lord and know by it His greatness and majesty and that grandeur (KibriyÄ') is not fitting except for Him, exalted and sublime. And for that reason, He bestowed favor upon him, saying: "Have We not made for him two eyes, and a tongue, and two lips? And guided him to the two paths?" And He made known his baseness first, saying: "Was he not a sperm-drop from semen emitted? Then he became a clinging clot." Then He mentioned His favor upon him, saying: "Then He created and proportioned, and made from him the two sexes, male and female," so that his existence may continue through reproduction as his existence first occurred through origination.

a.g: And a tongue and two lips?
And have shown him the two ways?
But he has not broken through the difficult pass.
And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
It is the freeing of a slave
Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
An orphan of near relationship
Or a needy person in misery
And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
Those are the companions of the right.
But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.
Over them will be fire closed in.
